com.github.detro.jsonconf
Class JSONConfBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.github.detro.jsonconf.JSONConfBuilder

public class JSONConfBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

This Builder helps to create a JSONConf object. It can be tuned to the specific needs of your code, and can assemble together (via algebraic UNION operation), all the JSON files given to it.

There is only one mandatory parameter: 1 "default" JSON file. After that, everything is optional.

Particular attention needs to be given to the "user" JSON files. The final JSONConf can be the UNION of many of those: the order in which this UNION is executed is based on the order in which they are provided.

JSONConfBuilder

public JSONConfBuilder(java.lang.String defaultConfFilePath)
Creates a ConfigurationBuilder (Builder Pattern)

Parameters:
defaultConfFilePath - Path to the Default Configuration File. "null" string will determine an empty (but valid) configuration file.

JSONConfBuilder

public JSONConfBuilder(java.lang.String defaultConfFilePath,
                       java.lang.String... userConfFilePaths)
Creates a ConfigurationBuilder (Builder Pattern)

Parameters:
defaultConfFilePath - Path to the Default Configuration File. "null" string will determine an empty (but valid) configuration file.
userConfFilePaths - Path to the User Configuration Files "null" string will determine an empty (but valid) configuration file.
Method Detail

withUserConfFilePath

public JSONConfBuilder withUserConfFilePath(java.lang.String... userConfFilePaths)
Provide paths to a User Configuration Files. The order in which files are added DOES influence the order in which files are united. This can be used multiple times: every time the Paths are added in queue to the list of User Conf files provided so far.

Parameters:
userConfFilePaths - Path to the User Configuration File "null" string will determine an empty (but valid) configuration file.
Returns:
Same ConfigurationBuilder instance (for chaining)

withSystemProperties

public JSONConfBuilder withSystemProperties(java.util.Properties sysProps)
Provide Properties in which to look for CLI Properties Array. If not configured, this builder will use System.getProperties()

Parameters:
sysProps - Properties container
Returns:
Same ConfigurationBuilder instance (for chaining)

propsArrayName - Name of the Properties Array to look for within the given System Properties.
Returns:
Same ConfigurationBuilder instance (for chaining)

build

public JSONConf build()
Builds the Configuration, based on the given parameters. The provided JSON files will be UNITED one at a time, in the order they have been provided.

Returns:
New Configuration, based on the given parameters.

loadJsonFromFile

protected com.google.gson.JsonObject loadJsonFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
Loads a JsonObject from a FilePath. NOTE: The filePath will be first searched within the Project Resources, then on the Filesystem as a RELATIVE path.

Parameters:
filePath - (Relative) Path to JSON File we want to load
Returns:
JsonObject from the given file

protected static com.google.gson.JsonObject union(com.google.gson.JsonObject... objects)
Algebraic Union of "n" JsonObjects.

Parameters:
objects - Variable list of JsonObjects
Returns:
A JsonObject containing the Union of all Objects, applied in order.

jsonPathAssignmentToJsonObject

protected com.google.gson.JsonObject jsonPathAssignmentToJsonObject(java.lang.String jsonPathAssignment)
Converts an assignment expressed via JsonPath into a JsonObject. Expected format would be something like: 
     json.path.assignment=1

The resulting object would look like: 

     {
         "json" : {
             "path" : {
                 "assignment" : 1
             }
         }
     }

Parameters:
jsonPathAssignment - JSON Path assignment
Returns:
JSON Object result of the assignment

stringToJsonElement

protected com.google.gson.JsonElement stringToJsonElement(java.lang.String input)
Converts a String to a valid JsonElement

Parameters:
input - A value that can be converted to a valid JSON element
Returns:
A valid JsonElement, based on the input string
